item.description:
Important Weather Update!! The forecast is 70 percent chance of precipitation at this point for rain and possible Thunderstorms. Please check the weather forecast prior to attending. If you decide to cancel please update your RSVP to NO.

Click Here for Coastal Zone Forecast for York Maine Coastal Area


Open to all Sea and recreational kayaks

Join us for an afternoon paddle launching at the Kittery Town Dock at Peperill Cove then paddling up Chauncey Creek with the incoming tide then crossing the estuary into Brave Boat harbor. Those with sea kayaks and the necessary skills may want to circumnavigate Gerrish Island. Others will head back the same route with the outgoing tide and we'll stop at Chauncey Creek dockside restaurant for an afternoon dining experience.

See photo above for view of Chauncey Creek & Brave Boat Harbor

Bring a snack to eat and water/beverages to consume the trip also bring cash if you plan to join us at Chauncey Creek restaurant.

Life vests aka PFDs must be worn at all times while paddling with this group

Directions:
* Take Interstate 95 North from Portsmouth, NH
* Take exit 2 to merge onto ME-236/Rte-236 toward US-1
* At the traffic circle, take the 3rd exit onto ME-236/Rogers Rd
* Slight left at ME-103/Whipple Rd Continue to follow ME-103
Continue to follow ME-103 2miles Belamy Rd is on right at Pepperil Cove / Captain Simeons Restaurant
Note: There is limited parking at town dock but after unloading you can park across from Captain Simeons "there is a parking fee at Captain Simeons lot" or at the elementary school down the road where parking is free.

NOTE: There is now a $3 Launch Fee being collected for using the Peperill Cove Boat Ramp.

Google Maps directions to launch site at Kittery Town Dock at Pepperill Cove
item.name: Chauncey to Brave Boat Harbor Kittery Point Maine Paddle
